title: Corporate Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the team in a panel/networking style group. Get to see what different teams within the org do on a day-to-day basis Panel interview at the end if you're selected past networking
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join the organization? Tell me about your external experience

title: Exchange Participant Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was really nice and friendly, it felt more like a conversation rather than an interview. She laid down the position details and asked if I had any questions at the end of the discussion.
Interview Questions: Sell me this pen I'm holding.

title: VP, Marketing & Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: Rigorous process which included  multiple steps: video, resume, case submission, interviews (1 with the incoming president and 1 with a board member). Its important to display how you've been able to leverage your past AIESEC experiences.
Interview Questions: How will you go about implementing your Case ideas, if you were to be selected?

title: B2C Sales Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and nice, I would say that the atmosphere of a run-by-student non-for-profit worldwide organization is inspiring. I enjoyed it there.  You could grow there, as well—it's a nice place to start your career as a junior.
Interview Questions: - how can you contribute, and what do you want to achieve (very casual classy questions )

title: Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC (Vancouver, BC) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy and the interviewers were really nice! They mainly want to get to know and understand why you are trying to join AIESEC and how you will fit in. Some interviews they might ask you to pitch something to them, however I didn't have this question!
Interview Questions: Q: What is a company you find interesting, why?

title: Exchange Participant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at AIESEC in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
you have to apply via their website, they will have an individual interview and group interview 
they will see if you have the traits that they are looking for. You don't need to have fancy working experience, they will train you later anyways.
Interview Questions: why do you apply AIESEC?

title: Exchange Participant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at AIESEC in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: i applied online during the recruitment. the whole interview process was pretty relaxed as the interviewer (I believe they're vice presidents or something) were really nice and friendly. they asked personal questions related to my previous experiences, future goals as well as why I applied for the position. got a phone call a few days later telling me that i got accepted.
Interview Questions: where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC (Edmonton, AB) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviews. The first one was a nearly one-hour group interview and the second one was an individual interview. After the group interview, you need to fill in a feedback form online including what you learned through the interview and why you want to join Aiesec or something like that.
Interview Questions: We were assigned to few groups and had to finish some group games together.

title: Global Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at AIESEC (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Individual interview since I did not have time for group interview. Took place in our university. The manager is younger than me and he was super nice and friendly. Many hypothetical questions was asked.
Interview Questions: your weaknesses and strengths

title: OGT Outgoing Global Exchange Talent Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
1. Online written application
2. Individual interviews 
3. Final group interview 
The interview was quite lengthy, the interviewers asked me behavioural questions with many follow up questions to understand whether if I am capable of being a good team player.
Interview Questions: Why we should hire you, why we should not hire you, leadership experience

title: Exchange Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Online Application, Individual Interview, then Group Assessment. Passing all three stages is required to be recruited. Both interviews are done in person. Individual interview lasted for roughly 30 minutes and assessment lasted 3 hours.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join us?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC (Ottawa, ON) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1. Application: fill out a questionnaire with multiple questions on AIESEC, the portfolio we apply for, and ourselves
2. Confidence Vote: give a 5 minutes speech (all candidates), answer a round of questions from members in the local committee (2 groups that have to answer questions during 45 minutes each)
3. Interview: lasts around 45 minutes, mostly questions about team management, the portfolio we apply for, and our reactions to certain situations
Interview Questions: What's the value proposition of oGT?

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Individual interviews, followed by a group interview and another final one on one interview. The interview was a mix of formal as well as casual questions that required you to demonstrate your creativity but also your experience.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the organization?

title: Outgoing Exchange and Marketing & Communication Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC (Scarborough, ON) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was an AIESEC speaker session at my university so that was where I first heard of AIESEC hiring for team member positions. The interview lasted an hour but the applicants and I had to switch every 15 minutes to be interviewed by ALL teams, to see which team you are most suited for (even though I only applied to 2 teams). The employers were friendly and nice.
Interview Questions:
Who is your favorite superhero?
Do you have any experiences with Photoshop?
How would you promote AIESEC?

title: National Support Team Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a competency based interview with AIESEC Canada's national team members. It was averaged hard, and the interviewer are friendly. The whole interview process was very pleasant and I have a good time talking with all the people.
Interview Questions: Why do u want to be part of the team?

title: LCVP Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC (Montreal, QC) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Writed application to submit, then interview at night with all the other candidates. They test you on your abilities to manage stress and work with a team by collaboration. Then, question about our year plan. A week after, you get called to be let know if you will be part of the team or not. Nice experience.
Interview Questions:
Who do you not want to work with?
What did you fail last year?

title: Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: i was invited to a panel interview. there were 3 members of aiesec including a professor and it took about an hour. it was pretty simple and straightforward at first to make you comfortable. then it got into more hypothetical/ situational questions. lots of questions to see how you would react in certain situations if you were abroad. make sure you are confident and positive.
Interview Questions: How would you handle working with someone it was impossible to get along with. what would you do?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online with resume and letter of intention.  Had an interview with the local manager and then in front of a student board.  Standard questions such as, why do you want to join AIESEC, what international experience do you have, what type of work experience are you looking for.
Interview Questions: What if you receive another offer when applying for jobs through AIESEC.

title: Talent Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: All behavioral based questions, basically went over my experiences on my resume and asked questions relating to soft skills needed for the jobs i applied. The people interviewed me are friendly and the whole interview process was more of a conversation, very relaxed. They also care about whether you are interested in diversity very much as they are an international organization that participates in international exchanges or abroad working opportunities.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Application had to include previous experiences. They require it to be more aiesec tailored. Recommendation letters are needed. Other questions relating to the specific role are also asked. The interview process included behavioural questions and also skills related questions
Interview Questions: What is your experience with aiesec?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at AIESEC (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact online.  Used personal reference to land interview.  Half hour first round interview.  All day interview for second round.
Interview Questions: What item in the room best represents you?
